intro: Diotocranus lebrunii var. sparsipilus, commonly known as the sparsely hairy diotocranus, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus species. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and lobed leaves, which help it adapt to its native environment. Its flowers are typically yellow or pale green, with five petals and stamens. It is often found in moist, well-drained soils in tropical and subtropical areas.
